title: Scarlett Moffatt shouts at woman in furious birthday party bust-up
text:
Despite the argument, Scarlett refused to let it ruin her birthday (Picture: Scarlett Moffatt/Instagram; Google)

Scarlett Moffatt was celebrating her 29th birthday earlier this week and got into a bit of a verbal bust-up at a bingo hall party.

The Libran TV presenter’s birthday weekend at Dabbers, in Shoreditch East London, got derailed after an argument with a woman at the party, who it appeared had made fun of her, according to a video obtained by The Sun.

The former Gogglebox star could be heard in the video clip shouting: ‘He’s not good? He’s not good?

Scarletts police officer boyfriend was at the birthday bash (Picture: Scarlett Moffatt/Instagram)

‘She’s f***ing laughing at me. This is my birthday. She’s laughing at me, man.’

According to the publication, Scarlett had been partying it up with her boyfriend Scott Dobinson, celebrity mate James Argent as well as friends and family when she got entangled in an argument.

A witness said: ‘Scarlett was in good spirits and looking forward to enjoying her birthday.

She uploaded an explanation on her Instagram (Picture: Scarlett Moffatt/Instagram)

‘But it all kicked off later in the night and Scarlett…her outburst may have shocked people used to seeing her laughing and joking on the telly.’

‘She had become distressed,’ the onlooker concluded.

Moffatt appeared to have addressed the event in her Instagram stories later that night in what can either be seen as hinting that she’s dropped friends over the incident, or that she’s proud of them.

‘Your friends should speak up for you when you feel low,’ she wrote. ‘If they don’t, dump them.’

She added: ‘Feel really lucky going into my 29th chapter of life with supportive friends, family & boyfriend. It’s hard sometimes letting people go but it’s important for your mental health.’

Metro.co.uk has contacted Scarlett Moffatt’s reps for comment.
